event.title: the discovery of several Clovis sites in eastern North America in the 1930s

data.event: After the discovery of several Clovis sites in eastern North America in the 1930s, the Clovis people came to be regarded as the first human inhabitants who created a widespread culture in the New World.

event.title: a hundred years ago, and for that railroad and its successor BNSF Railway continues

data.event: The Atchison, Topeka, & Santa Fe Railway system helped to establish Clovis over a hundred years ago, and for that railroad and its successor BNSF Railway continues to be a major hub of operations.
